ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Sure, it is interesting and enlightening. Great course!
I wil definitely recommend this course for others. Even though I couldn't do well in this course because I haven't had enough background knowledge, I can learn many things.
Yes!I think it is really beneficial for me to take the course, thus I understand another aspect of biological research besides the pure molecular approach.
I would recommend this course to another student if they are interesting in learning about how pathways are discovered using a genetic approach.

I would say, "Just like the course description says, it's a nice overview of analytical genetic techniques and technologies. However, be prepared to spend a lot of timeon flies and worms. For me, the course didn't really get interesting until we departed the 80s and 90s and got into some of the more modern advancements. At the end of the day, however, I did appreciate knowing the history behind some of the pivotal discoveries in the field."Overall, I would recommend this course to my classmates (non-geneticists).

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Wherever I do my thesis, I know that the concepts I learned in this class will aid me.
I don't anticipate entering the Genetics field, but I think this course has provided good background for interpreting genetically-oriented literature when I encounter it.
I think it is really beneficial for me to take the course, thus I understand another aspect of biological research besides the pure molecular approach.

This course did deepen my knowledge of the genetics field. Dr. Kim's lecture was particularly relevant to my dissertation research. The other lectures were good information to have so that I can understand how the molecular pathways and the etiology of disease are discovered.

As a non-geneticist I don't think this course will have any direct impact on my dissertation research. However, I do feel that I am better equipped to read and understand my own disciplines literature especially with regard to the modern techniques involving sequencing and the epigenome.
